text: I understand this is a difficult time. But defending working people‚Äôs rights is at the heart of everything trade unions believe in. For the sake of working families now and in the future, we can‚Äôt support a deal that will trash those rights. We ask MPs to vote against it. 7/

text:
While the chancellor pats himself on the back, working people are paying the price for the PM‚Äôs disastrous mishandling of Brexit.

text:

MPs must call her out, get no deal off the table and extend Article 50.

text:
Solidarity with outsourced @pcs_union members at BEIS, striking today for decent pay. The dept should lead by example, bring contracts back in-house and pay all workers a real living wage. 

Great to join you this morning, and enjoy your brilliant picket playlist!

users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text:
Yesterday, Theresa May said her party had a proud tradition of protecting workers‚Äô rights.

¬†The party behind the Trade Union Act and tribunal fees? The government that refuses to ban zero-hours contracts?

We won't be taken in. Our hard-won rights aren't safe in their hands.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Join a union https://t.co/QOSNJOruXb #HeartUnions https://t.co/JrCMDtAuMY
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: The PM is asking us to entrust our rights at work to a Tory-dominated parliament. That's not a compromise, it's a bad joke. Jobs and rights are still in the firing line. https://t.co/FbFe9kkH7C
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Take this with a massive pinch of salt. Only way to guarantee workers' rights is to write protections into the deal and stick by SM and CU rules. Nothing to stop future Tory leaders from ripping up domestic law - exactly what the hardliners aim to do. https://t.co/YmETOlJXWP
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: A huge blow for Sunderland and the north east. Painful proof that the government's failure on Brexit is hurting investment in the areas that need it most. https://t.co/CRvATbnHEm
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Thanks to all those MPs who recognised that we need a better deal, that protects jobs and rights. Nothing changed last night, and neither has our determination to win a Brexit deal that delivers for working people.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Today MPs can take the prime minister‚Äôs threat of no-deal off the table. Here‚Äôs our message. https://t.co/Qek2evmGT5
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text:
The PM hasn't given us the guarantees we need on jobs or workers' rights. Tweaks aren't enough - we need substantial change to the¬†whole deal.

But even after a catastrophic defeat, her red lines haven't shifted and the threat of no deal hasn't even been taken off the table. https://t.co/AmTlpzXwbw
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Important speech from @Keir_Starmer today. We've said all along that sticking by Single Market and Customs Union rules provides the strongest guarantee for jobs and rights. If the PM can't deliver that, then the people need to have the final say.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: This crushing defeat shows that Theresa May is out of options. It‚Äôs time to give the people the final say, whether through a general election or popular vote.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Though UK governments can and should go higher than EU minimum standards, an EU-wide safety net on rights is a vital protection for UK workers. And the honest truth is the only cast-iron guarantee we can see is cross-border union solidarity and membership of the single market.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Vague assurances aren't good enough. This deal won't stop future governments from watering down our workers' rights. Unions have been clear that we need a binding guarantee that rights in the UK won't fall behind the rest of Europe.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Disappointing, disingenuous intervention from Greg Clark. The government that introduced the Trade Union Act and refused to ban zero-hours contracts now expects working people to take this Brexit deal on trust? https://t.co/bBvjgJCy3Z
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: The PM has talked a big game on workers' rights all along, but once again the reality falls short. This isn't the binding, long-term guarantee that working people need https://t.co/XCO8Z4hzCJ
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: It was a privilege to speak at the memorial for Max Levitas yesterday. His spirit lives on today, as we continue that fight against fascism, for a new deal for working people and for our NHS. This film features Max ‚Äì and a few other famous faces too! https://t.co/e5t9fzMGuy
